title.narrative: POLICIES, PLANS AND BUDGETS FOR CHILDREN

description.narrative: Government at central and sub-national levels has strengthened capacity to improve equity focus and priorities children in policies, plans, and budgets, which contributes to Access To Inclusive Social Protection, Economic And Social Policy General, Public Finance And Local Governance, Reducing Child Poverty. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Child poverty in all its forms is reduced through quality, evidence-based policies, programmes and budgets for all children, especially the most marginalized, at national and subnational levels

PF4C: Engagement with budget processes to improve social sector budgets (sufficiency, efficiency, effectiveness, transparency, equity)

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Government at central and sub-national levels has strengthened capacity to improve equity focus and priorities children in policies, plans, and budgets

description.narrative: A;high-level political dialogue was conducted with Members of Parliament to present;key;findings of the 2019/2020 Sectoral Budget Briefs and how to address public finance;challenges during the budget scrutinization process. These high-level advocacy interventions contribute to addressing;human resource gaps in;the;health and education;sectors. Moreover, UNICEF;is working with key;government partners on Intergovernmental Fiscal Transfers and Budget Issues Papers to address disparity issues in allocation of resources among Local Govenrment Authorities and investigate structural and operational budget implementation bottlenecks hampering the delivery of basic social services.; | Status:On-track | As-of Date:22/12/2021

title.narrative: Evidence generated on budgets and their linkages to child outcomes to improve budget allocations/expenditure for children

baseline.value: Intermediate (2) UNICEF has generated evidence to support budget allocation/ expenditure, but advocacy has not yet demonstrated improved budget allocation/ expenditures

target.value: 2021:Advanced (3) UNICEF generated evidence and advocacy has led to improved budget allocation/ expenditure

actual.value: 2021:UNICEF interventions contributed to increase budget execution performances in the health and WASH sectors.

title.narrative: (NOT VALID after Dec 31 2017) National budgetary frameworks that address child poverty and disparities

baseline.value: Issues of adequacy, effectiveness, efficiency and equity affecting public social sector spending, with sub-national allocation formulas largely ineffective in addressing disparities.

target.value: 2021:Allocations to child-focused areas increased in national and sub-national budget, quality of spending enhanced, and allocation formulas for key social sectors revised for increased equity focus.

actual.value: 2021:UNICEF interventions contributed to enhance budget allocations and execution rates. UNICEF is currently commissioning a review of intergovernmental Fiscal Transfers to address inequity issues

title.narrative: Extent to which the national decentralization legal and policy framework reflects equity and child rights considerations(66230)

baseline.value: Weak (Score 1) Ad hoc references to poor and/or disadvantaged children as beneficiaries of decentralization reform

target.value: 2021:Established (Score 3) Poor and/or disadvantaged children are consistently referenced as beneficiaries in laws and/or other legal instruments that formally establish decentralization framework.
